title: Molar Mass Calculator
description: Calculate molar mass from molecular formula

examples.problem: Calculate the molar mass of Ca(OH)₂

study_tips.concept: Molar mass is the mass of one mole of a substance. It's numerically equal to the formula mass but has units of g/mol.
key_points: Add atomic masses of all atoms in the formula
Multiply by subscripts for each element
vce_connections: Unit 1 AoS 2: Essential for all stoichiometric calculations
Unit 3 AoS 1: Required for solution preparation
common_errors: Using wrong atomic masses from periodic table
extensions: How do you handle hydrated compounds like CuSO₄·5H₂O?
What's the difference between formula mass and molecular mass?
How does isotopic abundance affect molar mass?

interactive_questions.question: Calculate the molar mass of aluminum sulfate Al₂(SO₄)₃
interactive_questions.follow_up: 342.15 g/mol. Notice: 2 Al atoms, 3 S atoms, and 12 O atoms total!

interactive_questions.question: Find the molar mass of glucose C₆H₁₂O₆
interactive_questions.follow_up: 180.16 g/mol. This sugar molecule is fundamental to cellular respiration.
